newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes up slightly vs US dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes up slightly vs US dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed up slightly at 8.2951 on Wednesday from Tuesday's 8.2952 against the U.S. dollar in Shanghai, but trading was dull, dealers said.
The weighted average price on Tuesday was 8.2952.
Dealers said the yuan moved in a narrow range as it did on Tuesday given a lack of fresh market-moving news.
The yuan opened unchanged at 8.2952 and moved between 8.2951 and 8.2955 for most of the session, hitting an intraday high of 8.2942 and a low of 8.2957.
Trading was dull with most done at 8.2952, traders said.
One dealer said no one seemed keen to trade beyond a small range around the 8.2950 level.
"There was no reason to push the yuan up or down," he said.
A second dealer said the central bank took no action on the market, which added to traders' sense of caution.
He said he expected the yuan to continue to consolidate around 8.2950 on Thursday.
The yuan closed up at 6.7850 from 6.8204 against 100 Japanese yen and down at 1.0721 from 1.0705 against the Hong Kong dollar.
